page.title: 13INDUSTRY
page.content: {POWDERHAM SAWMILL It was built as a sawmill in the 17th century. In the time of water power. The lady who's in charge of the mill has lived and worked at the sawmill for 7 years. They get their wood mainly from plantations on Haldon Woods near Exeter and other private farms. The main types of woods are (hard) oak, chestnut (soft woods) birch and douglas. They send the products locally and to the south of England. They have not had any accidents yet. Eight men work at the sawmill and there are four saws,two pullover saws and two break down. They use ten cubic metres of wood per day.
